title: Jennifer Aniston teases epic Friends reunion although a reunion show won't happen
text:
Jennifer Aniston recently reunited with her Friends co-stars Courteney Cox, David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry, Lisa Kudrow and Matt LeBlanc.

But the 50-year-old actress broke some tough news to fans as she appeared on Howard Stern's Sirius XM Radio program on Monday, where she admitted there was little-to-no chance of an official Friends reboot happening.

Talking about the impromptu reunion, she explained that 'Schwimmer was in town and we all happened to have a window of time so we all got together.'

Reunited: Jennifer Aniston recently reunited with her Friends co-stars Courteney Cox, David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry, Lisa Kudrow and Matt LeBlanc, but they did not discuss a reboot

Laughs: 'We laughed so hard,' Aniston said, while revealing that the dinner happened at Cox's home, adding it was, 'very civilized but we laughed a lot'

'We laughed so hard,' Aniston said, while revealing that the dinner happened at Cox's home, adding it was, 'very civilized but we laughed a lot.'

She went on to say that they all 'miss [the show] every day' and that she'd be, 'nothing without it,' but when the talk turned to a reunion show, she admitted it was a non-starter.

'I really think there is an idea if there is a reboot of the show, it won't be even close to as good what it was,' Aniston said.

'So why do it? It would ruin it,' Aniston said.

Single life: Jennifer Aniston is enjoying the single life, stating she's too busy to date following her 2017 split from actor Justin Theroux

She also said she's enjoying the single life, stating she's too busy to date following her 2017 split from actor Justin Theroux, stating she likes being single.

'Yeah, and I'm very busy,' she added. 'For now. I'm promoting [The Morning Show]. I'm prepping for next season'

The Morning Show is her new series that launches on the new Apple TV Plus streaming service on November 1, which she stars in alongside Reese Witherspoon.

New show: The Morning Show is her new series that launches on the new Apple TV Plus streaming service on November 1, which she stars in alongside Reese Witherspoon

The actress seemingly confirmed that the streaming service has already renewed the show for a second season, though it has not been confirmed by Apple yet.

As for her love life, she turned down the shock jock's offer to set her up, adding that she is not a fan of set-ups.

'Hey, listen, I just don't like being set up. I don't like it. I hate it,' she told Stern.

New role: Aniston makes her return to television with Apple's The Morning Show, her first series regular role since leaving Friends in 2004

Aniston started dating Brad Pitt in 1998 and they married two years later, and they were married from 2000 to 2015.

The actress started dating Justin Theroux in 2011 and they married in 2015, before their split at the end of 2017.

Aniston makes her return to television with Apple's The Morning Show, her first series regular role since leaving Friends in 2004.

The actress portrays news anchor Alex Levy, who takes on her morning show on her own after her co-anchor (Steve Carell) is fired after an alleged sexual misconduct scandal.

She must also contend with an ambitious journalist gunning for her job, played by Reese Witherspoon.
